metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34473 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: The HTML Sanitizer should have sanitized the href attribute of SVG <use> tags; however it incorrectly did not sanitize xlink:href attributes. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
